works.complaint:
We have signage posted advising that we charge storage  
fees for vehicles left here more than 1 week after repairs are completed -  
$30/day
Truck was ready December 20TH and the bill was $4279
Pat would not have agreed to let the truck stay over a month
Calls were attempted to get the customer to come pay and remove the truck
We began charging storage fees January 1st and continued attempts to  
contact the customer
February 20th I sent a registered mail advising them of the charges to date  
and requesting payment & removal of the truck
They refused to sign for the letter and it was returned unopened (Their  
policy since they often get sued according to Russ)
March 8th the truck was seized under the Garage Keeper’s Lien Act, I  
believe the bailiff sends out a “Notice of Objection” to the owner
March 30th Bailiff sent out a “Notice of Intent to Dispose of Collateral”  
for $6389.12 plus any additional costs
Then Austin showed up with $4500 (I think) and Brandon advised the bill was  
much higher now due to seizure and storage.
April 13th Darryl Agnew was contacted and they offered $5000.  He passed  
info to Dan Smith who requested I call them back.
April 13th I called Russ Hughesman and we made a settlement arrangement for  
$5246.82, however Austin had already left for BC and would not return until  
Tuesday to get the truck and pay.
